title: This Captivating Coastal Farmhouse Fits Perfectly In Its Bushland Location
description: Building on a rugged coastal escarpment is always a bit of an obstacle. Even more so when the site has strict bushfire controls. And yet, Klaus Carson Studio expertly navigated these challenges in their Ironbark House project to create a spectacular and simple farmhouse on the NSW South Coast. Rather than working against the natural topography of the landscape, the architects wove the house into the undulating setting, beautifully framing bushland views.
author: The Design Files
